title.narrative: Institutional Measures and Technical Assistance to Address Air Pollution in Asia Pacific

description.narrative: Air pollution poses impacts on human health and the wellbeing of people, particularly in developing countries. Recent estimates by the World Health Organization placed air pollution as the world’s largest single environmental health risk with nearly 7 million deaths per year. Seventy percent of these deaths occur in Asia and the Pacific region. Air pollution, which is transboundary in nature, also contributes to regional level issues such as acid deposition and global level issues such as climate change. Recognizing this, the inaugural session of the United Nations Environment (UNEA) adopted a Resolution on air pollution that, among others, calls on Governments to “formulate action plans and establish and implement nationally determined ambient air quality standards and to establish emissions standards for their significant sources of air pollution”. UNEA Resolution requests UNEP to support Member States in addressing air pollution issues.This project, building on the existing networks, seeks to promote coordination mechanism and science-policy assessment at the regional level, intergovernmental processes at the sub-regional level, and complementary capacity building at the national level in Asia and the Pacific region.UNEP, through its Regional Office, will implement the project in partnership with multidisciplinary team of experts and institutions. A Joint Forum on air pollution that will be established with the participation of governments and existing air pollution related initiatives will provide overall guidance and policy directions for the implementation of the project.
